column3: A grep in the repository doesn't show any usages at this folder.\nConcept ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16589/commits/fa4ee0ddf1b5150a9dcdd3bb711d5a06220ecebb
@hebasto \n\n*  Quick version string hack that was never fixed #16588

Concept ACK. Looks like this folder and src/obj/test were related to the original addition of the Boost test framework in #356. \n\n`src/obj/test` was renamed to `src/obj-test` [to workaround bug in older GNU Make ](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/777/commits/34c69036dae7b4be100100cc99eb1dbe32fe1bef) in #777.
Though I don't think it needs to be in **git**. The build script creates it as necessary to put `build.h` in.\n
Again, for `src/obj`, please see:\n\n*    Quick version string hack that was never fixed #16588

> Again, for src/obj, please see:

I don't think that's helpful. I know why it exists.

FWIW: I've tried removing the `src/obj` directory from git and it still builds, the build script creates the `src/obj` directory in the *build* directory. It doesn't need to exist in the git repository.
> I don't think that's helpful. I know why it exists.\n\nAh sorry. I meant to say that removing that folder should be done as part of the pull request that fixes #16588
